content:
✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Imaginative clash of code! I would have some difficulty to get it right fast but it is interesting

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: A very good clash.
I like the idea here.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: The clash is nice and the description is clear!

I do however suggest you to follow the friendly hints of Timinator concerning the text of the goal section; currently some sentences are not completely correct. Or, following as much as possible your text, I would suggest the following (but, unlike Timinator, English is not my first language, so my text might be incorrect as well):
'You have to find where the coin is hidden. We start with many glasses, under one of which we hide a coin. We move around the glass, and you have to find out under which glass the coin is hidden. We have input 0-0-0-0-x; the x means that we start with the coin under glass number 5. After that, we have some numbers +5 and -2, which means we shift the coin 5 to the right or 2 to the left. Thus, the coin will be under the third glass, and we answer in output 0-0-x-0-0.'

I still approved the clash, because the description is clear enough, my own English is also not perfect, and the clash is nice.

Nice Clash! This is the exact kind of Clash that makes me mad. I did it pretty fast (2 or 3 minutes) and I know some other Codingamer or TWO would have done it faster than me.

I have the utmost respect for people that speak multiple languages. I (unfortunately for me) only speak one. If I may, I'd like to suggest the following edits to your goal section:

You must locate a hidden <<coin>>, represented by an {{x}}. To start, a set of <<glasses>>, represented by zeros {{0}}, is lined up and a coin is hidden under one of them. The glasses are moved around, and you must identify under which glass the coin is located at the end.

For example, given input of <<0-0-0-0-x>>, the {{x}} means the coin starts under glass number 5. After that, input of <<+5>> and <<-2>> mean the glass with the coin under it is shifted by 5 to the right and then by 2 to the left wrapping around to the beginning or end as necessary. Thus, the coin will be under the third glass at the end, and the answer to output is <<0-0-x-0-0>>.

Goal section
* I think you mean "many glasses" instead of "many glass".

* I think you mean "shift" instead of "sh*t".

Input section
* Line 2: There are more than one integer, so please change "an integer" to "space-separated integers".

* You don't need to show an example here. That's what the Example section is for. Besides, I have no idea why "*" is part of line 1 - shouldn't it be "x"?

Thanks.
